smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All provided pages contain model elements.
All use cases in the 'Treeningute funktsionaalne allsüsteem' diagram (Page 2) are connected to at least one actor.
No actors have multiple use cases with synonymous names.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package context on the provided diagrams.

No clear evidence of redundant data columns across unrelated tables without foreign keys. Attributes like 'on_nous_tülitamisega' appear in both Klient and Külastaja, but these represent attributes of distinct subclasses/roles rather than disconnected redundancy of the same data instance.
All use cases follow the 'Verb + Noun' naming convention (e.g., 'Registreeri treening', 'Vaata kõiki treeninguid').
In the state diagram (Page 7), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable from the start node via the defined transitions.
In the activity diagram (Page 3), all actions are reachable through the decision flows.
All visible relationships on class and database diagrams (e.g., Page 5, Page 17) have multiplicity indicators defined at both ends (e.g., '1' and '0..*').
The use case diagram 'Treeningute funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 12 use cases, exceeding the threshold of 9 central elements.

On the 'Isikute register' diagram (Page 5), the class 'Isik' has 6 visual connection lines (3 associations and 3 generalizations). Similarly, on the 'Treeningute register' diagram (Page 9), the class 'Treening' has 6 visual connections.
The diagram layouts are generally compact and consistent; no related elements are separated by excessive distances relative to the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters (shortest classes found were 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Ruum', which are 4 characters).
All class and table names start with an uppercase letter and use the singular form (e.g., 'Isik', 'Klient', 'Treening').
On the 'Klientide register (transformed)' diagram (Page 15), the table 'Klient' contains the column 'Kliendi_number', which starts with an uppercase letter.
All table names are in the singular form (e.g., 'Tootaja', 'Klient').
No Hungarian notation or disallowed prefixes were found in element names. Prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_', 'pfK' found in the database models are explicitly allowed.
